knowledge: Hepatitis Hepatitis S.  Alcoholic hepatitis is within the spectrum of alcoholic liver disease.  This ranges in order of severity and reversibility from alcoholic steatosis, alcoholic hepatitis, cirrhosis, and liver cancer.  Hepatitis usually develops over years-long exposure to alcohol, occurring in 10 to 20% of alcoholics.  The most important risk factors for the development of alcoholic hepatitis are quantity and duration of alcohol intake.  Long-term alcohol intake in excess of 80 grams of alcohol a day in men and 40 grams a day in women is associated with development of alcoholic hepatitis.
